body.p: What proportion of students score between 400 and 600 on the SAT-M? In other words, find P(400 < X < 600).

explanation.p: We need to find P(400 < X < 600), where X is a normal random variable with a mean of 507 and a standard deviation of 111.
The z-score of 600 is (600 − 507)/111 = 0.84 (rounded), and therefore,
We conclude that roughly 63.1% of the students score between 400 and 600.
